headline: 'This Is Just A Necessary Spend': Back-To-School Spending Holds Steady Despite Economic Uncertainties
summary: Summer may be just getting underway, but plenty of parents are already planning their spending for the upcoming school year. Nearly 75% of parents plan to spend the same or more on back-to-school shopping this year, a consumer survey from PwC found. And more than one in three parents actually plan to spend more this year than they have previously. Economic uncertainties and the effects of the tariffs had many experts uncertain as to whether or not back-to-school shopping would drop sharply this

headline: Bloom Nutrition Launches Better-For-You Soda, Bloom Pop, Exclusively at Walmart
summary: Bloom Nutrition, one of the fastest-growing wellness essentials brands of the decade, is proud to announce the launch of its latest innovation: Bloom Pop, a better-for-you soda where bold, bubbly flavor meets real gut health benefits. This release follows the record-breaking success of Bloom Sparkling Energy, which sold over 35 million cans in its first year and became the highest trialed energy drink on record according to Numerator.

headline: Hello Bello and Dr. Seuss Enterprises Launch New Collection at Walmart, Bringing Dr. Seuss Babies to Diapering for Families Nationwide
summary: Hello Bello, the better-for-you baby care brand known for combining premium performance with accessible pricing, is proud to introduce its newest collection in collaboration with Dr. Seuss. The new collection features Dr. Seuss Babies, a new brand with adorable baby versions of classic Dr. Seuss characters, and is available now at select Walmart stores and nationwide on Walmart.com. headline: Will Tariff-Induced Supply Chain Unpredictability Grinch-ify 'Christmas in July'?
summary: In last year's 48-hour window, Amazon Prime Day set a record of $14.2 billion in sales revenue. The online retail giant has increased the duration of its biggest sales event of the year to four days in 2025, running from July 8 to July 11. Walmart, Target, Best Buy, Kohl's and other retailers are attempting to get the jump on Amazon by starting their versions of "Black Friday in July" sales events on July 7, with some running past July 11.

raw.headline: Will Tariff-Induced Supply Chain Unpredictability Grinch-ify 'Christmas in July'?
